listCustomWeapons.name: Full Metal Deck
listCustomWeapons.description:
All 54 cards in this deck are made from cold iron. Each card functions as a +1 striking wounding shuriken, and they count as cold iron for the purposes of resistance and weaknesses. You can etch fundamental runes directly to the deck as if it was a shuriken, which replicates the etched runes to all of the cards on the deck.

Activate—Shuffle the Deck (concentrate,manipulate) Effect All cards return to the deck.
Activate—Restore the Deck 10 minutes (manipulate) Effect You replace any damaged cards in the deck with new ones. This requires you to have a spare deck of cards (either playing cards or a harrow deck) which you destroy in the process. Full Metal Deck is restored, if it was missing any cards it now has 54 cards again.

listCustomWeapons.name: Greater Full Metal Deck
listCustomWeapons.description:
All 54 cards in this deck are made from cold iron. Each card functions as a +2 greater striking astral wounding shuriken, and they count as cold iron for the purposes of resistance and weaknesses. You can etch fundamental runes directly to the deck as if it was a shuriken, which replicates the etched runes to all of the cards on the deck.

Activate—Shuffle the Deck (concentrate,manipulate) Effect All cards return to the deck.
Activate—Restore the Deck 10 minutes (manipulate) Effect You replace any damaged cards in the deck with new ones. This requires you to have a spare deck of cards (either playing cards or a harrow deck) which you destroy in the process. Full Metal Deck is restored, if it was missing any cards it now has 54 cards again.

listCustomWeapons.name: Greater Virgil's Saw
listCustomWeapons.description:
This +2 greater striking serrating katar deals slashing damage instead of piercing, and looks like a hand saw.
Activate—Saw in Half (manipulate, illusion) Frequency once per day; Effect You perform a quick show and saw yourself in half from the waist. Your lower half becomes invisible and you cast a 6th rank illusory creature spell but the image looks like your lower half and can attack by kicking. The image uses your attack modifier with virgil's saw, and your attack modifier + 10 for any DCs. You do not need to sustain the spell and it lasts for 1 minute unless it ends early. When the illusory creature spell ends your lower half becomes visible again.
listCustomWeapons.weaponTraits: Uncommon, Agile, Deadly d6, Magical, Monk, 3rd Party

listCustomWeapons.name: Major Full Metal Deck
listCustomWeapons.description:
All 54 cards in this deck are made from cold iron. Each card functions as a +3 greater striking greater astral wounding shuriken, and they count as cold iron for the purposes of resistance and weaknesses. You can etch fundamental runes directly to the deck as if it was a shuriken, which replicates the etched runes to all of the cards on the deck.

Activate—Shuffle the Deck (concentrate,manipulate) Effect All cards return to the deck.
Activate—Restore the Deck 10 minutes (manipulate) Effect You replace any damaged cards in the deck with new ones. This requires you to have a spare deck of cards (either playing cards or a harrow deck) which you destroy in the process. Full Metal Deck is restored, if it was missing any cards it now has 54 cards again.
Activate—Unleash the Deck (manipulate)
Requirements you have at least 50 cards in the deck; Frequency once per day; Effect You throw the entire deck in shocking speed. All creatures in a 50-foot cone take 16d6 slashing damage (DC 38 basic Reflex Save). The cards embed into the surfaces in the area, making them hazardous terrain until the start of your next turn. A creature that moves through this hazardous terrain takes 3 piercing damage for every square of the area it moves into. At the start of your next turn all the cards return back to the deck.

listCustomWeapons.name: True Virgil's Saw
listCustomWeapons.description:
This +3 major striking greater extending serrating katar deals slashing damage instead of piercing, and looks like a hand saw.
Activate—Saw in Half (manipulate, illusion) Frequency once per day; Effect You perform a quick show and saw yourself in half from the waist. Your lower half becomes invisible and you cast a 9th rank illusory creature spell but the image looks like your lower half and can attack by kicking. The image uses your attack modifier with virgil's saw, and your attack modifier + 10 for any DCs. You do not need to sustain the spell and it lasts for 1 minute unless it ends early. When the illusory creature spell ends your lower half becomes visible again.
listCustomWeapons.weaponTraits: Uncommon, Agile, Deadly d6, Magical, Monk, 3rd Party

listCustomWeapons.name: Virgil's Saw
listCustomWeapons.description:

Activate—Saw in Half (manipulate, illusion) Frequency once per day; Effect You perform a quick show and saw yourself in half from the waist. Your lower half becomes invisible and you cast a 2nd rank illusory creature spell but the image looks like your lower half and can attack by kicking. The image uses your attack modifier with virgil's saw, and your attack modifier + 10 for any DCs. You do not need to sustain the spell and it lasts for 1 minute unless it ends early. When the illusory creature spell ends your lower half becomes visible again.

listCustomEquipment.name: Charlatan's Instrument
listCustomEquipment.description:
A charlatan's instrument can be crafted in the form of any variety of handheld musical instruments. A charlatan's instrument grants you a +1 item bonus to Performance checks while playing music with the instrument.
Activate—Annoying Performance (concentrate, manipulate) Effect You play the instrument, causing it to cast a 3rd rank musical accompaniment spell. However, the spell's duration is unlimited.

listCustomEquipment.name: Greater Charlatan's Instrument
listCustomEquipment.description:
A charlatan's instrument can be crafted in the form of any variety of handheld musical instruments. A charlatan's instrument grants you a +2 item bonus to Performance checks while playing music with the instrument.
Activate—Annoying Performance (concentrate, manipulate) Effect You play the instrument, causing it to cast a 3rd rank musical accompaniment spell. However, the spell's duration is unlimited.
Activate—Charlatan's Parade (concentrate, manipulate) Frequency once per day; Effect You play the instrument, causing it to cast an instant parade spell.

listCustomEquipment.name: Greater Toxin
listCustomEquipment.description: Poisons ooze and drip from weapons etched with this rune. The weapon deals an additional 1d6 poison damage on a successful Strike, plus 2d6 persistent poison damage on a critical hit. The poison damage dealt by this weapon (including the persistent poison damage), as well as poisons delivered by this weapon ignore the target's poison resistance or immunity.

listCustomEquipment.name: Magician's Marvelous Cloak
listCustomEquipment.description:
Every magician uses a cloak. But yours hold a lot more secrets than usual. The cloak grants you a +3 item bonus to Performance checks

Activate—Vanishing Act (manipulate) Frequency once per day; Effect You cast a disappearance spell (Counteract DC is 41).
Activate—Predicament Escape (manipulate) Frequency once per day; Effect You cast a momentary recovery spell.
Activate—Audience Participation (manipulate) Frequency once per day; Effect You cast a cast into time spell (DC 41).

listCustomEquipment.name: Toxin
listCustomEquipment.description: Poisons ooze and drip from weapons etched with this rune. The weapon deals an additional 1d6 poison damage on a successful Strike, plus 1d6 persistent poison damage on a critical hit.

listCustomEquipment.name: True Charlatan's Instrument
listCustomEquipment.description:
A charlatan's instrument can be crafted in the form of any variety of handheld musical instruments. A charlatan's instrument grants you a +2 item bonus to Performance checks while playing music with the instrument.
Activate—Annoying Performance (concentrate, manipulate) Effect You play the instrument, causing it to cast a 3rd rank musical accompaniment spell. However, the spell's duration is unlimited.
Activate—Charlatan's Parade (concentrate, manipulate) Frequency once per day; Effect You play the instrument, causing it to cast an instant parade spell.
Activate—Boastful Charlatan (concentrate, manipulate) Frequency once per day; Effect You play the instrument, causing it to cast an 8th rank belittling boast spell.

listCustomFeats.name: Advanced Trickster Spells
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Trickster Spells
You gain your choice of one trickster focus spell from the advanced trickster spells (or another you have access to).

Special You can select this feat more than once, choosing a different spell each time.

listCustomFeats.name: Basic Tricks
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You heard of these people called wizards that cast spells that can change the very nature of the world so you wanted to be like them. You gain a spellbook. You learn two spells from your available traditions. These spells can be from the same tradition or from different traditions. You also learn two spells each time you gain a new rank scroll following the same limitations. Those spells can be of equal or lower rank than the scroll's rank. You can also add more spells to your spellbook with Learn a Spell activity.

Each day during your daily preparations, you can create a temporary scroll containing a 1st-rank spell from your spellbook. This scroll is a temporary item
and loses its magic the next time you make your daily preparations if you haven't already used it.
At 6th level, add a second temporary scroll containing a 2nd-rank spell. At 8th level, add a third temporary scroll containing a 3rd-rank spell.



Pathbuilder note: This feat adds a spellbook archetype caster for the purposes of keeping track of your known spells and available scroll ranks

listCustomFeats.name: Deceive Magic Item
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites legendary in Deception
Your lies are so convincing that even inanimate objects believe them. If your next action is to Cast a Spell from a magic item, a wand, a staff or a scroll, attempt a Deception check against a very hard DC of the item's level. On a success you don't spend the charges for a staff, a scroll isn't destroyed, or a wand can be used one more time before needing to overcharge it. For any other items with a frequency, this use doesn't count against its frequency. Then you cannot use Deceive Magic Item again until the next time you make your daily preparations. On a failure, you activate the item as normal.

listCustomFeats.name: Distract Caster
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites legendary in Performance
Frequency once per day
Trigger A creature you can perceive Casts a Spell
Your performances can be extremely captivating. Roll a Performance check to Counteract the spell, using half your level rounded up as your counteract rank. On a critical success, you can choose to receive the effects of the spell on yourself by confusing the target so much that they cast the spell on you, even if you're not within the usual range of the spell.

listCustomFeats.name: Enhanced Familiar
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites a familiar


Pathbuilder Note: this is a duplicate feat of the original, that grants the original feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Expert Tricks
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Basic Tricks; master in Arcana, Nature, Occultism or Religion
In addition to your daily scrolls from Basic Tricks, add a scroll with a 4th-rank spell. At 14th level, add a scroll with a 5th-rank spell. At 16th level, add a scroll with a 6th-rank spell.


Pathbuilder note: This feat adds a spellbook archetype caster for the purposes of keeping track of your known spells and available scroll ranks

listCustomFeats.name: Familiar
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Pathbuilder Note: this is a duplicate feat of the original, that grants the original feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Favored Magic Item
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You like your magic items, maybe even too much. You couldn't let go of that cool magical item you found ages ago so you learned how to make them more effective even now. During your daily preparations, you can select a magical item that has a saving throw DC, it gains the invested trait if it doesn't already have it. You can use your Class DC or Spell DC instead of that item's DC as long as you have that item invested or until the next time you make your daily preparations, whichever is shorter.

listCustomFeats.name: Final Trickster Spell
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Greater Trickster Spells
You have managed to pull a great trick and steal a powerful spell. You gain a focus spell of your choice that has a base rank of 8 or lower. The focus spell can be from any source like a class or a different archetype but your GM is the final arbiter on what spell you can gain with this feat. That focus spell becomes a trickster focus spell for you.
You can also use this feat to gain any trickster focus spell you haven't gained already.
Your proficiency rank for spell attacks and spell DCs increases to master.

Pathbuilder note: This feat only gives you the ability to choose from the trickster focus spells. You'd need to add a custom special that grants you the focus spell you want if you wish to use this feat to gain any focus spell available.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Trickster Spells
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Trickster Spells
You gain your choice of one trickster focus spell from the greater trickster spells (or another you have access to). The first time you gain this feat your proficiency rank for spell attacks and spell DCs increases to expert.

Special You can select this feat more than once, choosing a different spell each time.

listCustomFeats.name: Implausible Purchase
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Predictive Purchase


Pathbuilder Note: this is a duplicate feat of the original, that grants the original feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Master Tricks
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Expert Tricks; legendary in Arcana, Nature, Occultusim or Religion
In addition to your daily scrolls from Basic Tricks and Expert Tricks, add a scroll with a 7th-rank spell. At 20th level, add a scroll with an 8th-rank spell.


Pathbuilder note: This feat adds a spellbook archetype caster for the purposes of keeping track of your known spells and available scroll ranks

listCustomFeats.name: Minor Manifestation
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites legendary in Arcana, Nature, Occultism and Religion
Frequency once per day
Your knowledge of magic became so great you can use it to reshape it in anyway you wish. You can cast a common spell of 7th rank or lower. You can Use your class DC in place of any necessary spell DC and your class DC – 10 in place of any necessary counteract modifier or spell attack modifier. The GM might allow broader access to spells.

listCustomFeats.name: Overcharge Staff
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Basic Tricks; Trick Staves
Those spellcasters have a special trick they use with their fancy staves. So you learned how to replicate it with your scrolls. During your daily preparations you can destroy a single scroll you made with your trickster archetype feats and add an amount of charges to your staff equal to the scroll's rank.

In addition, when you activate a staff, you can spend 1 charge from your staff and destroy one of your scrolls you made with your trickster archetype feats that you're wielding and cast a spell from the staff of the same rank as the destroyed scroll.

Lastly, you can draw and hold a scroll in the same hand holding a staff and can activate either of them without issues.

listCustomFeats.name: Predictive Purchase
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Pathbuilder Note: this is a duplicate feat of the original, that grants the original feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Quick Trick
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
You keep a knick-knack for any situation and retrieve them at remarkable speed. You Interact to draw an item.

Special If you have Expert Tricks, the frequency becomes once per hour, and if you have Master Tricks the frequency becomes once per 10 minutes instead.

listCustomFeats.name: Quick Trickster
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Those fey run around at incredible speeds, and they're amazing tricksters. They must be great tricksters because of their speed! You're permanently quickened. You can use your extra action only to Interact to draw an item, or use a Skill Action.

listCustomFeats.name: Sneak Attacker
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Pathbuilder Note: this is a duplicate feat of the original, that grants the original feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Summon Trickster
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
What is better than one trickster? Two tricksters! You can cast summon fey as a primal innate spell once per day, heightened to half your level rounded up.


Pathbuilder note: The spell doesn't automatically heighten on pathbuilder.

listCustomFeats.name: Trick Staves
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Those wizards all seem like they walk around with their cool walking sticks. So you went and learned how to use one of those as well. You can activate magical items that require you to be able to Cast a Spell, provided you activate them to Cast a Spell from your available traditions. For any effects of these items that use a spell DC or spell attack roll, you can substitute your Class DC, or your Class DC - 10 for spell attack rolls.

You can also prepare a staff that has at least one spell from your available traditions, using half your level rounded up to determine the number of charges you add. This doesn't allow you to cast spells that are not from your available traditions.

listCustomFeats.name: Trickster Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites trained in Arcana, Nature, Occultism or Religion; trained in Deception or Performance
You never liked playing by the rules. So you decided to become a magician without going through all the hassle of "studying" or being born with it. Choose Deception or Performance. You become trained in that skill or become expert if you were already trained in it.

In addition, you can activate scrolls of any magical tradition that you have at least trained proficiency in its matching skill. The relevant skills are Arcana for arcane, Nature for primal, Occultism for occult and Religion for divine. These traditions that you have at least trained proficiency in its matching skill will be referred to as your available traditions. You can use your class DC for the scroll's DC, and your class DC - 10 for the scroll's spell attack rolls and counteract checks.

listCustomFeats.name: Trickster Spells
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You heard of these spells that the wizards and the sorcerers can cast over and over again. You wanted in on some of that action yourself. You gain your choice of one trickster focus spell from the fledgling trickster spells. The rules for focus spells appear on page 298 of Player Core.

The first time you gain this feat choose a tradition from your available traditions. Focus spells gained from the Trickster archetype are spells of that tradition. Your spellcasting ability for these spells is Charisma. You become trained in spell attacks and spell DCs.

Special You can select this feat more than once, choosing a different spell each time.

listCustomSpells.name: Captivating Visage
listCustomSpells.traits: Cantrip, Emotion, Hex, Mental, Visual, Witch, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 30 feet; Targets 1 creature


Your patron's beauty—or their majestic aspect—manifests within you and you focus their visage on a target within range, dealing 1d4 mental damage and other effects depending on its Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.
Success The target takes half damage.
Failure The target takes full damage and becomes fascinated by your visage.
Critical Failure The target takes double damage and becomes fascinated by your visage. The target cannot recover from the condition while the spell is active and the target can see you.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

listCustomSpells.name: Disappearing Act
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range varies

You can't be a trickster without knowing how to pull a disappearing act. Your trick is so convincing that space bends to your will allowing you to teleport.

1-action You teleport up to a distance equal to your Speed to an unoccupied space within your line of sight.
2-action You teleport up to a distance equal to double your Speed to an unoccupied space. You don't need to be able to see your destination as long as you know its relative location and distance from you.

listCustomSpells.name: Stage Illusions
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 30 feet; Targets 1 creature or varies
Duration 1 hour

You are the master of illusions! You have a variety of illusions that you can use in all manner of situations.
1-action The spell targets one creature and has the effect of Illusory Disguise.
2-action The spell targets a 20-foot burst area and has the effect of Illusory Object.
3-action The spell targets a 30-foot burst area and has the effect of Illusory Scene.

In all versions the selected spell effect is of the same rank as stage illusions, using stage Illusions' range and duration.

Heightened (7th) You can target up to 6 willing creatures with the 1-action version.
Heightened (9th) You can change the duration to unlimited. If you do casting the spell again ends any previous casting.

listCustomSpells.name: Trickster's Switch
listCustomSpells.traits: Concentrate, Focus, Hex, Teleportation, Witch, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 30 feet; Targets 2 creatures
You attempt to switch the places of 2 creatures within range. The targets must attempt a Will saving throw. A target gets a -1 circumstance penalty to this save if they were already under the effects of a hex. A willing creature can choose to fail its save instead of rolling a saving throw.

Success If either target succeeds on their saving throw, neither target is affected.
Failure If both targets failed on their saving throw, the two targets swap places. Each creature must be able to fit into their new spaces or the effect fails.
Critical Failure As failure but a creature who critically fails is also Stunned 1.

Heightened (+1) The range increases by 10 feet.

listCustomSpecial.name: Deception Expert
listCustomSpecial.description: Sets Deception proficiency to expert.

listCustomSpecial.name: Deception Trained
listCustomSpecial.description: Sets Deception proficiency to trained.

listCustomSpecial.name: Disappearing Act
listCustomSpecial.description:
Advanced Trickster Spell


Cast [one-action]/[two-actions]
Range varies

You can't be a trickster without knowing how to pull a disappearing act. Your trick is so convincing that space bends to your will allowing you to teleport.

[one-action] You teleport up to a distance equal to your Speed to an unoccupied space within your line of sight.
[two-actions] You teleport up to a distance equal to double your Speed to an unoccupied space. You don't need to be able to see your destination as long as you know its relative location and distance from you.

listCustomSpecial.name: Dreamer's Call
listCustomSpecial.description:
Advanced Trickster Spell


Cast [two-actions]
Range 30 feet; Targets 1 creature
Defense Will; Duration until the end of the target's next turn

You create a vivid, illusory daydream drawn from the images of the target's dreams. The daydream appears in an unoccupied space in range, and you attempt to draw the target toward it.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.
Success The target's attention wavers. It becomes fascinated by the daydream.
Failure The target is fascinated with the daydream and pursues a course of action you choose as its first action after you Cast the Spell: approach the daydream, run away from it (as the fleeing condition), Release what it's holding as an offering, or Drop Prone in obeisance.
Critical Failure As failure, but the target follows the course of action for as many actions as possible for the spell's duration, and does nothing else.

listCustomSpecial.name: Face in the Crowd
listCustomSpecial.description:
Fledgling Trickster Spell


Cast [one-action]
Duration 1 minute
While in a crowd of roughly similar creatures, your appearance becomes bland and nondescript. You gain a +2 status bonus to Deception and Stealth checks to go incognito among the crowd, and you ignore difficult terrain caused by the crowd. This counts as setting up a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception and you add your level even if you're untrained.
Heightened (3rd) The spell gains a range of 10 feet and can target up to 10 creatures.

listCustomSpecial.name: Ignite Ambition
listCustomSpecial.description:
Fledgling Trickster Spell


Cast [reaction] ; Trigger You or an ally in range attempt to use a mental effect to convince a creature to do something (such as a Coerce, Request, or a suggestion spell)
Range 60 feet; Targets one creature being influenced
Defense Will

You strengthen the target's ambition, increase its resentment of its allies, and make its allegiances more susceptible to change. It must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and realized you attempted to influence its reaction with magic.
Success The target takes a –1 status penalty to its defenses against the triggering effect. This penalty is –2 if the target is being encouraged to advance its own ambitions. The target doesn't realize you Cast the Spell on it.
Failure As success, but the status penalty is –4 if the target is being encouraged to advance its own ambitions.
Critical Failure As success, but the creature automatically follows a suggestion that advances its own ambitions.

listCustomSpecial.name: Invisibility Cloak
listCustomSpecial.description:
Advanced Trickster Spell


Cast [two-actions]
Duration 1 minute

You become invisible, with the same restrictions as the 2nd-rank invisibility spell.

Heightened (6th) The duration increases to 10 minutes.
Heightened (8th) The duration increases to 1 hour.

listCustomSpecial.name: Lesson of Transposition
listCustomSpecial.description: A trickster should be able to move creatures to their whims. You gain the Trickster's Switch hex, and your familiar learns Nature's Pathway.

listCustomSpecial.name: Performance Expert
listCustomSpecial.description: Sets Performance proficiency to expert.

listCustomSpecial.name: Performance Trained
listCustomSpecial.description: Sets Performance proficiency to trained.

listCustomSpecial.name: Read Fate
listCustomSpecial.description:
Fledgling Trickster Spell


Cast [two-actions]

Range 30 feet; Targets 1 creature other than you

You attempt to learn more about the target's fate in the short term, usually within the next day for most prosaic creatures, or the next hour or less for someone likely to have multiple rapid experiences, such as someone actively adventuring.

You learn a single enigmatic word connected to the creature's fate in that time frame. Fate is notoriously inscrutable, and the word isn't necessarily meant to be taken at face value, so the meaning is often clear only in hindsight. The GM rolls a secret DC 6 flat check. If the creature's fate is too uncertain, or on a failed flat check, the spell yields the word “inconclusive.” Either way, the creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

listCustomSpecial.name: School of the Trickster
listCustomSpecial.description:
Whether you studied in a proper school or just learned from a fey, you use illusions and bewitching magic to get whatever you want or just for a little bit of fun.

Curriculum cantrips: Figment, Prestidigitation
1st: Charm, Command, Illusory Disguise
2nd: Dispel Magic, Laughing Fit
3rd: Enthrall, Slow
4th: Confusion, Mirage
5th: Hallucination, Slither
6th: Dominate, Mislead
7th: Duplicate Foe, Mask of Terror
8th: Disappearance, Quandary
9th: Metamorphosis

School Spells initial: Sudden Shift; advanced: Trickster's Twin.

listCustomSpecial.name: Select Trickster Dedication Skill
listCustomSpecial.description: I couldn't figure out a way to give expert proficiency if you were already trained in your chosen skill, so I had to do it in an ugly way sadly. Choose expert choices only if you were already trained in that skill.

listCustomSpecial.name: Select a Final Trickster Spell
listCustomSpecial.description: Select a greater, advanced or fledgling trickster focus spell

listCustomSpecial.name: Select a Greater Trickster Spell
listCustomSpecial.description: Select a greater, advanced or fledgling trickster focus spell

listCustomSpecial.name: Select a Trickster Spell
listCustomSpecial.description: Select a fledgling trickster focus spell

listCustomSpecial.name: Select an Advanced Trickster Spell
listCustomSpecial.description: Select an advanced or fledgling trickster focus spell

listCustomSpecial.name: Stage Illusions
listCustomSpecial.description:
Greater Trickster Spell


Cast [one-action]-[three-actions]
Range 30 feet; Targets 1 creature or varies
Duration 1 hour

You are the master of illusions! You have a variety of illusions that you can use in all manner of situations.
[one-action]The spell targets one creature and has the effect of Illusory Disguise.
[two-actions] The spell targets a 20-foot burst area and has the effect of Illusory Object.
[three-actions] The spell targets a 30-foot burst area and has the effect of Illusory Scene.

In all versions the selected spell effect is of the same rank as stage illusions, using stage Illusions' range and duration.

Heightened (7th) You can target up to 6 willing creatures with the 1-action version.
Heightened (9th) You can change the duration to unlimited. If you do casting the spell again ends any previous casting.

listCustomSpecial.name: Sudden Shift
listCustomSpecial.description:
Fledgling Trickster Spell


Cast [reaction] ; Trigger An enemy misses you with a melee attack
Duration until the end of your next turn

You swiftly move from a dangerous spot and veil yourself. You Step and become concealed.

listCustomSpecial.name: Sweet Dreams
listCustomSpecial.description:
Fledgling Trickster Spell


Cast [two-actions]
Range 30 feet; Targets 1 willing creature
Duration 1 hour

With soothing words, you lull the target into an enchanting dream. When you Cast the Spell, the target falls unconscious if it wasn't already. While unconscious, it experiences a dream of your choice, though lucidly enough it can wake when it pleases. If it wakes up before 1 minute of sleep has passed, the spell ends.

Dream of Insight +1 status bonus to Intelligence-based skill checks
Dream of Glamor +1 status bonus to Charisma-based skill checks
Dream of Voyaging +5-foot status bonus to Speed.

If you Cast this Spell again, any previous sweet dream you cast ends.

Heightened (4th) The bonus for a dream of insight or glamor is +2.
Heightened (7th) The bonus for a dream of insight or glamor is +3.

listCustomSpecial.name: The Trickster
listCustomSpecial.description:
You were a part of your patron's plans before you even met them. The cold and calculating nature behind their guise became clear when you first met your patron. Your patron may be a powerful fey from the First World like a Nymph or even an Eldest, or some other powerful entity that is known for their tricks and schemes like a Deimavigga devil.

Spell List Primal
Patron Skill Nature
Lesson of Otherworldly Charm Your patron taught you the power of appearances. You gain the Captivating Visage hex and your familiar learns Charm.
Familiar of Glamorous Dance Your familiar dances around playfully as it moves, blending the colors around it. When you Cast or Sustain a hex, you can cause your familiar or a willing creature within 15 feet of your familiar to become Concealed for 1 round. As usual, you cannot use such obvious concealment to hide.

listCustomSpecial.name: Trickster's Twin
listCustomSpecial.description:
Advanced Trickster Spell


Cast [two-actions]
Range 30 feet; Targets 1 creature
Defense Will; Duration 1 minute

You rarely settle for being in just one place. Choose a location within 100 feet of the target that the target can see. You create an illusion of yourself there that only it can see and that mimics all your actions. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.
Success The target believes you're in the designated location and can't see you in your actual location. The target automatically disbelieves the illusion when you use an action that doesn't make sense in the illusion's position, or if the target attacks, touches, Seeks, or otherwise engages with the illusion. If you use a hostile action against the target, the spell ends.
Failure As success, but the target must succeed at a Will save to disbelieve the illusion when one of the listed events occurs.
Critical Failure As success, but the target must critically succeed at a Will save to disbelieve when one of the listed events occurs.

listCustomSpecial.name: You're Mine
listCustomSpecial.description:
Greater Trickster Spell


Cast [two-actions]
Range 30 feet; Targets 1 creature
Saving Throw Will; Duration 1 round

You manipulate the target's emotions, potentially allowing you to control it for a brief instant. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.
Success The target is stunned 1.
Failure On the target's next turn, it's stunned 1 and you partially control it, causing it to take a single action of your choice. If it has actions left, it can act normally.
Critical Failure The target is controlled for 1 round.

Heightened (7th) On a failure, the target is controlled for 1 round. On a critical failure, the target is controlled for up to 1 minute; it receives a new Will save at the end of each of its turns, and on a success, the spell ends.
